name: R-T
description: R-T is designed to be a helpful information kiosk, but he's also been given the task of monitoring all activity within Starr Park. For safety reasons, of course.

gadgets.name: In Line
gadgets.description: R-T signals his legs while split, damaging enemy brawlers in between for 700 and slowing them.

gadgets.name: Hacks!
gadgets.description: Instantly trigger all active marks on all enemy brawlers, dealing their damage.

starpowers.name: Recording
starpowers.description: R-T and his legs take 20% less damage when split.

tips: Be careful about choosing where to place R-T's Super, as leaving his legs unprotected for too long enables enemies to defeat R-T by shooting a stationary target.

R-T should only use his Super when he's at full health or near full health, as both of his parts start out with the same amount of HP that he has before using his Super. Using his Super while low on health is very risky as any projectile hitting either part of him would defeat him.
R-T should primarily use his Super against short-ranged brawlers. This is because the range of his Super's attack is very short, leaving him vulnerable to brawlers with long ranges.

If a close range brawler gets close to R-T, he can use his Super and position himself so that both his head and legs are damaging the attacking brawler. This does devastating damage to them and will almost certainly defeat them. Using the Recording Star Power increases R-T's survival when using this tactic.
Using R-T's Super against a Brawler with piercing attacks like Emz or Janet is almost useless, as they can simultaneously damage him and his legs.
Be especially aware of Penny, as her main attack can splash after hitting either R-T's head or legs.
Beware of turrets when R-T is in his alternate form, like Penny's or Jessie's, as they can outrange R-T and possibly defeat it without the help of his other part.

When using his Super in Showdown, use his alternate form to burst down enemies behind walls, and his normal form to engage longer-ranged enemies. His Super's teleportation can be a helpful escape strategy but be wary of where his legs were placed; as the legs are stationary, the gas limits R-T's time in his alternate form, so while bursting enemies try to get your super as fast as possible for immediate use.
Using R-T's alternate form's extra speed can be very effective, for example to score a goal in Brawl Ball, quickly taking a few Gems in Gem Grab, or trying to get a last-second kill in Bounty.
R-T's Hacks! Gadget can be used to defeat marked targets that have very low health and are hiding behind a wall.

history.description: R-T became available to play in the Training Cave.
R-T, his Crimson, and his Patrol skins were added to the game.
R-T's Hacks! Gadget and Recording Star Power were added.
R-T's health was decreased to 3900 in both forms (from 4100).
R-T's delay between attacks was increased by 100% while in his alternate form.
All Brawlers' health and damage were increased from 5% to 10% with each Power Level.
Fixed an issue with the Crimson R-T skin having extra abilities.
R-T's In Line Gadget damage was increased to 560 (from 500) and now scales with Power Levels.

R-T's flavor text was changed from "Lost in Starr Park? No worries, friend! R-T is watching you! Erm, no. He's watching OVER you. Yes. That. Totally." to "R-T is designed to be a helpful information kiosk, but he's also been given the task of monitoring all activity within Starr Park. For safety reasons, of course."
R-T's rarity was changed to Mythic (from Chromatic).
